meanings.definition: To make someone or something live forever
meanings.sent1: The artist was immortalising the beauty of nature in his painting.
meanings.sent2: Many cultures have rituals for immortalising the spirits of their ancestors.
meanings.sent3: By painting a portrait of his pet fish, he was immortalising its memory in a unique way.
meanings.sent4: The writer's words had the power of immortalising emotions on paper.
meanings.sent5: The ancient legend tells of a magical potion capable of immortalising those who drink it.

meanings.definition: To preserve the memory of someone or something forever
meanings.sent1: The historian was immortalising the stories of the past through his writings.
meanings.sent2: Photographs are a way of immortalising special moments in time.
meanings.sent3: She joked that by writing her name on the cake, she was immortalising herself in dessert history.
meanings.sent4: The museum's exhibit was immortalising the achievements of great inventors.
meanings.sent5: The poet's verses had the magic of immortalising fleeting emotions.
